page.title: 03 HOME LIFE
page.content: In general, the standard of living in the area's homes is above the national average, with scarcely any unemployment, most homes having a washing machine, freezer and television(s), about half with video recorders and tumble driers and 47% of our small survey owning one or more home computers. As the number of children taking packed lunches to school increases, more and more families have the main meal of the day in the evening, although some still choose to cook at midday. The use of the freezer to store food is widespread, and most families shop weekly or less frequently. The older folk are looked after too. Meals on Wheels (prepared at the school) are delivered to their homes.
